patterns_reference.reason: Learning OOP, state machines, grid systems

forbidden_rules.procedural_sprawl: Must use OOP (ES6 classes) - lesson from Pong

gameplay.notes: Multi-level progression, lives, hit zones for skill-based play all working perfectly

visuals.notes: Colorful brick grid, better than Pong but still simple shapes

audio.notes: Adapted Pong's audio system, different tones for different brick types

code_quality.notes: OOP architecture - Brick, Ball, Paddle classes. Much more maintainable than Pong

patterns_to_keep.why: Much cleaner than procedural - Brick, Ball, Paddle classes isolated concerns
Perfect for brick arrangement, easy to design levels
Clean state transitions: menu -> playing -> levelComplete -> gameOver
Adds skill - hit edges = sharp angle, center = straight

patterns_to_avoid.why: Needed careful direction checking to prevent ball embedding
patterns_to_avoid.lesson: Always check velocity direction before collision response

notes: OOP breakthrough - code SO much cleaner than Pong. Grid system worked perfectly. Hit zones added skill element. State machine pattern will be reused in all future games.
